alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 10:56AM EST until December 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The Deerfield River oversrpeads some of the lowest lying farmland in the Deerfield area. Floodwaters inundate a portion of Pogues Hole Road. Also lowest lying recreational fields and parking lots nearby the river start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 10.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 04/02/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
